make-dir

Make a directory and its parents if needed - Think mkdir -p

Advantages over mkdirp

  • Promise API (Async/await ready!)
  • Fixes many mkdirp issues: #96 #70 #66
  • 100% test coverage
  • CI-tested on macOS, Linux, and Windows
  • Actively maintained
  • Doesn’t bundle a CLI

Install

$ npm install make-dir

Usage

$ pwd /Users/sindresorhus/fun $ tree .

```js const makeDir = require(‘make-dir’);

makeDir(‘unicorn/rainbow/cake’).then(path => { console.log(path); //=> ‘/Users/sindresorhus/fun/unicorn/rainbow/cake’ }); ```

$ tree . └── unicorn └── rainbow └── cake

Multiple directories:

```js const makeDir = require(‘make-dir’);

Promise.all([ makeDir(‘unicorn/rainbow’) makeDir(‘foo/bar’) ]).then(paths => { console.log(paths); /* [ ‘/Users/sindresorhus/fun/unicorn/rainbow’, ‘/Users/sindresorhus/fun/foo/bar’ ] */ }); ```

API

makeDir(path, [options])

Returns a Promise for the path to the created directory.

makeDir.sync(path, [options])

Returns the path to the created directory.

path

Type: string

Directory to create.

options

Type: Object

mode

Type: integer
Default: 0o777 & (~process.umask())

Directory permissions.

fs

Type: Object
Default: require('fs')

Use a custom fs implementation. For example graceful-fs.
